column34: Please let us know where you heard about us?

column10: This area is fairly dangerous for pedestrians. There are no sidewalks, and drainage ditches on either side of the road, and drivers speed because there are no traffic calming devices either.

My family lives in this neighborhood, and I take my dog for a walk routinely. There are no traffic calming devices, and there is an apartment complex at Villa del Rey Ct; the people who live there speed through the neighborhood routinely. The posted speed limit is 25 mph, but drivers frequently drive at 50mph. 

To make matters worse, there are no sidewalks, and drainage ditches on either side of the road. Frequently people in our neighborhood park on the streets as well, narrowing the width of the street and further restricting room for pedestrians to coexist with cars safely.

I have been narrowly missed 3-4 times since we moved here in September 2021.
column21:
Drivers do not come to complete stops at stop signs, and there are no marked pedestrian crosswalks (and no sidewalks either, of course, so I guess that point is moot). 

We desperately need traffic calming devices. I don't think I've ever said this before, but we could use some police from time to time just to make drivers pay attention to the speed limit.
